column4: *sigh* why does it have to be an impossible task to setup a graphics card
it's not as if this is an obscure card
nvidia 7800gt
apparently not
as I continually get the low graphics prompt
every freaking time
I enabled the driver. I got low graphics prompt.
I configure, and go back in and the driver isn't enabled anymore.
don't use the configure dialog
you know your way around the console at all?
boot into recovery mode, drop into the console, delete your /etc/X11/xorg.conf file, sudo apt-get install nvidia-xconfig
then run nvidia-xconfig, reboot, and it should be working
(backing up your xorg.conf file if you feel it necessary, but it doesn't sound like you've done anything special with it
Did that, restarted, it tries to start x, blinks a few times
pastebin your /var/log/Xorg.log.0 file
still there?
gotta setup the network to pastebin heh
(apt-get install pastebinit, then you can just cat /var/log/Xorg.log.0 | pastebinit)
on brother's site, go to any particular printer, they have a linux section for pretty much all of them
sorry :p
got it pastebinned yet?  :p
